#summary Some tips and tricks

= Tips and Tricks =


=== View all available goals ===

  {{{
  mvn help:describe -Dplugin=com.jayway.maven.plugins.android.generation2:maven-android-plugin
  }}}


=== Shorter commandline ===

_If you only execute {{{mvn android:...}}} commands from the root of a Maven project where the {{{pom.xml}}} is configured for the maven-android-plugin, you don't need this configuration. It helps when you want to execute commands from other directories though._

Without any special settings, you can run standalone goals *from root directory of a Maven/Android project* like this: 

  {{{
  mvn android:deploy -Dandroid.file=myApp.apk
  }}}

... and from *any other directory* like this:

  {{{
  mvn com.jayway.maven.plugins.android.generation2:maven-android-plugin:deploy -Dandroid.file=myApp.apk
  }}}

With an extra setting, you can do it *in any directory* as easy as this:

  {{{
  mvn android:deploy -Dandroid.file=myApp.apk
  }}}

The extra setting you need, goes in your {{{~/.m2/settings.xml}}} file. Create it if you don't already have it:

  {{{
  <settings xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
            xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
            xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0
                        http://maven.apache.org/xsd/settings-1.0.0.xsd">

      <pluginGroups>
          <pluginGroup>com.jayway.maven.plugins.android.generation2</pluginGroup>
      </pluginGroups>

  </settings>
  }}}
